section.title: There is/are
section.sectiontitle: Use there is + singular noun and there are + plural noun to talk about people or things for the first time.
section.text1a: There is a girl in the living room.
section.text2a: There are two bedrooms in our house.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the contraction there's when you speak.
section.text3: There is a big cinema in my town.
section.text3a: There's a big cinema in my town.
section.text4: There is a problem with the computer.
section.text4a: There's a problem with the computer.

section.title: There is/are
section.sectiontitle: Use Is there + singular noun and Are there + plural noun to make questions.
section.text1a: Is there a kitchen in your apartment?
section.text2a: Are there any cinemas in your town?
section.sectiontitle2: Use not after there is/are to make negatives. We usually use contractions: there isn't and there aren't.
section.text3: There is not a dining room in the apartment.
section.text3a: There isn't a dining room in the apartment.
section.text4: There are not any factories in my town.
section.text4a: There aren't any factories in my town.
